Read the sentence.
:ibox:When my brother and I get together with our two favorite cousins we have so much fun.
What is the correct way to write the sentence?

A.Choice: When my brother and I, get together with our two favorite cousins we have so much fun.

B.Choice: When my brother and I, get together with our two favorite cousins, we have so much fun.

C.Choice: When my brother and I get together with our two favorite cousins, we have so much fun.

D.Choice: When my brother and I get, together with our two favorite cousins, we have so much fun.

Content: Read the paragraph.

:ibox:The Brooklyn Bridge is one of the most famous bridges in the United States. It stretches across the East River, linking the cities of New York and Brooklyn. The bridge took 600 workers more than 14 years to build; it was completed in the year 1883. About 150,000 people usually go over the Brooklyn Bridge.
How should the last sentence of the paragraph be rewritten to use the most precise language?

A.Choice: About 150,000 people use the bridge daily to cross to the other side of the river.

B.Choice: About 150,000 people walk, bike, or drive across the Brooklyn Bridge each day.

C.Choice: About 150,000 people use the bridge each day to cross the river.

D.Choice: About 150,000 people go across the river daily on the Brooklyn Bridge.

Content: A student is writing an essay about happiness. Read the student‚Äôs draft and answer the question that follows.

:ibox:Did you know that there are scientists who study happiness? Daniel Gilbert, who is a professor at Harvard University, has spent years learning about what makes people happy. He has even written a popular book on the topic. His book Stumbling on Happiness discusses how challenging it is for people to know today what will make them happy in the future. He notes, though, that people are usually able to adapt to change much better than they think they can.

According to Gilbert, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not supposed to be happy all the time.‚Äù It‚Äôs both normal and important to feel other types of emotions. We can appreciate happiness more if we don‚Äôt always have it. As Gilbert says, ‚ÄúHappiness is a place to visit, not a place to live.‚Äù The next time you‚Äôre feeling sad or even angry, remember that it is not really possible to always feel happy.
Which source would most likely offer the student the ùóïùóòùó¶ùóß additional information to include in the report?

A.Choice: an interview with Gilbert in which he answers questions about happiness

B.Choice: a short article that explains how Gilbert got a job teaching at Harvard University

C.Choice: an article written by one of Gilbert‚Äôs students about how happy the student was having Gilbert as a teacher

D.Choice: a bookstore website that has a short review of Gilbert‚Äôs book

Content: Which idea helped Bertocchini and her team to think that the worms may have something on their bodies that breaks down the plastic?

A.Choice: the speed at which the worms were able to make holes in the plastic

B.Choice: the number of holes each worm made in the plastic in one hour

C.Choice: the fact that holes appeared in the plastic even if the worms were not alive

D.Choice: the idea that other types of worms may make holes in other types of plastic

Content: Read the paragraph from the passage.

:ibox:Bertocchini‚Äôs research is promising. However, other scientists are doubtful. Ramani Narayan, a scientist from the University of Michigan, is one of them. He thinks that, if wax worms eat plastic, tiny pieces of plastic could work their way into the food chain. This plastic might then be harmful to other living things. He does not think that the worms are the answer to the problem of pollution.
Which sentences in the paragraph ùóïùóòùó¶ùóß support the idea that using worms to break down trash may be a bad idea? Choose ùóßùó™ùó¢ answers.

C.Choice: Ramani Narayan, a scientist from the University of Michigan, is one of them.

D.Choice: He thinks that, if wax worms eat plastic, tiny pieces of plastic could work their way into the food chain.

E.Choice: This plastic might then be harmful to other living things.

F.Choice: He does not think that the worms are the answer to the problem of pollution.

Content: Which sentence from the passage ùóïùóòùó¶ùóß explains how the research about one topic may encourage research about other topics?

A.Choice: She and her team kept careful records of what happened.

B.Choice: More tests are needed, of course, before millions of wax worms can be added to landfills.

C.Choice: Scientists agree that Bertocchini may have come across an important finding.

D.Choice: Some scientists also wonder whether a similar solution might exist for plastic waste in the ocean.
